summary: This document is a notification from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding the filing of an interlocutory criminal appeal by Ghislaine Maxwell in her case (20-3061). It includes an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office requesting a notice of appearance be filed and provides docketing details.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the appellant filing an interlocutory criminal appeal in her case (United States of America v. Maxwell).

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: She is listed as an Assistant U.S. Attorney to receive electronic notice of the appeal filing.

connections.description: Prosecution vs. defendant relationship in the criminal case United States of America v. Maxwell.
Laura Menninger is an Assistant U.S. Attorney representing the prosecution.

events.title: Filing of Interlocutory Criminal Appeal
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell files a notice of interlocutory criminal appeal in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals, case number 20-3061.

events.title: Court Notification of Appeal
events.description: The Second Circuit Court of Appeals sends a notice of docket activity regarding Maxwell's appeal to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell filed an interlocutory criminal appeal on September 9, 2020, in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals (case 20-3061).
The appeal is in the case United States of America v. Maxwell, indicating ongoing criminal proceedings against her.
Laura Menninger, an Assistant U.S. Attorney, is notified of the appeal filing on behalf of the prosecution.
The document includes internal DOJ communication requesting a notice of appearance be filed as additional counsel.
